answerText: Rebecca[10] This story by du Maurier, the author of Rebecca, is about Nat Hockens who sees many of his fellow townspeople die when they are attacked by masses of the title animals. It was made into a film by Alfred Hitchcock.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 6 | 9 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: A woman in this work is nearly tricked by into jumping out a window to her death, but the discovery of another character's intentionally sunken boat causes her not to jump. [10] Name this book that tells how Maxim de Winter shot and killed his the title character after being provoked by a story about an extramarital pregnancy. The housekeeper Mrs. Danvers works for Maxim de Winter in this book.
